title: Inside Simon Cowell's plush LA home as X Factor judge opens doors to celebrity stars
text:

Simon Cowell may be a multimillionaire thanks to his music and TV career, but he'll only ever dress in one uniform: an unbuttoned white shirt or t-shirt, high-waisted trousers and classic dad shoes.

But when it comes to his property portfolio, Simon is much more adventurous, having snapped up luxe mansions both sides of the Atlantic.

And tonight will see the famously private mogul fling open the doors of one of his grand designs to welcome in the stars of Celebrity X Factor .

Simon will be hosting the Judges' Houses segment of the show from his £18.7million Malibu mansion, which he bought in 2017 off his mate Brian Greenspun.

(Image: ITV)

(Image: ITV)

The beachfront pad boasts 10,000sq ft of airy space, which is kept hidden from prying eyes by way of a winding private drive.

It's got a whopping seven bedrooms and nine bathrooms, plus separate accommodation for all his staff who look after the place while he's in London.

There's even a guest suite with its own entrance, along with a tennis court for racket sport enthusiasts.

And the sky-blue pool sits surrounded by palm trees and a pristine green lawn, tended by Simon's team of groundkeepers.

An enormous free-standing bath is located next to the ground-to-ceiling glass windows in the master suite, allowing him to look out over the ocean as he wallows in the bubbles.

(Image: REX/Shutterstock)

It's even got a special massage room and a spa, all within the master suite.

Simon and his partner Lauren Silverman treat the Malibu mansion as a holiday home, as they mostly divide their time between their London property in Holland Park and their American bases in New York or Los Angeles' upmarket Beverly Hills.

For them, Malibu is a touch of luxury and very much a home away from home, where they can enjoy relative anonymity among the famous faces who live in the neighbourhood and hang out on the beach by the Pacific Ocean.

Speaking about their mansion recently, Lauren said: "The view just takes your breath away.

(Image: REX/Shutterstock)

"You can see all the way to the ocean and feel like you are in a treehouse."

As with his other properties, Simon was keen to stamp his mark on the Malibu pad as soon as he could.

He installed a screening room on the ground floor, saying: "Ninety-nine percent of people that put a cinema or a gym in the basement never use it, because it smells.

"Now you can open up the doors so that it's outside, and I've got another bar… you'll see there's a trend here."

Simon also revelled in the decoration of the property, which is done up in tasteful neutrals with a beige stone floor laid throughout the ground floor.

(Image: REX/Shutterstock)

"If I hadn't done TV or music, I might have done interior design," he recently mused.

"I like it, and I'm quite good at it. So I like to work with design teams who become collaborators."

But some of his home decor decisions keep him up at night, he admitted.

"We [Lauren and I] argue [about fabrics] all of the time, but then we love the same things, like lighting and symmetry," he laughed.

"Sometimes I wake up in the middle of the night and take her downstairs and go, 'I think I know why I hate this room!' and I'll drive her crazy."

(Image: REX/Shutterstock)

He admitted the LA place had taken a lot of blood, sweat and tears to get it up to his demanding standards.

"When I moved here, the house was uncomfortable and the garden looked like a desert. Now we have millions of flowers, so it smells nice and birds and insects come in."

Even so, this year's Celebrity X Factor hopefuls must have felt more than a little on edge as they were asked to wait in Simon's bedroom before performing in his garden.

The head judge set up a temporary stage among the tropical flowers where the contestants got to show off their vocals, but nerve-wrackingly they had to stay in the most intimate room of the luxury house before it was their time to shine.

*The X Factor: Celebrity continues tonight at 8.30pm on ITV
description: Simon Cowell will tonight welcome his celebrity singers to his gorgeous £18million Malibu mansion, which overlooks the Californian coastline
